body.section:
The eFaps-Shell is the possibilty to work with eFaps without using a Webapplication or a Applicationserver.eFaps must be properly installed and the connection to the database must be defined.The eFaps-Shell has several different Methods witch can be called by running the schell with parameters:
Compile the Programs: -compile
The parameter "-compile" compiles all programs witch are kept in the eFaps-Database
Create a new eFaps: -create
The parameter "-create" creates a complete new eFaps in the eFaps-Database, deleting all previous installations.
Create a new Unique Identifier: -generateUUID
The parameter "-generateUUID" connects the shell with eFaps a returns a new Universal Unique Identifier. This UUID are used by eFaps to identifie all kind of types.
Import Data into eFaps: -importData -basename %folder %XMLfile
The parameter "importData" starts the import of Data into eFaps from an XML-File. To import Files into eFaps the BaseName must also be given. The whole statment therfore must look something like:
-importData -basename /folder/folder /folder/folder/XML.xml
The concret definitions of the XML-File is explained in a sepeate Section.
Update Programs or Types in eFaps: - update %FileName
The paramter "-update" can update Types, Command, Programs and so on in the eFaps-Database. Therfore it must be called mit a parameter wich contains the File to be imported. That can be a ".java"-File to import/update a Program or XML-File to update a Type.
Import Persons: -importPersons
